lines.content: > “Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them.” – David Allen
### AmandaPro frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do. It's,
### All you need to do is
4. let it manage your tasks for you :kissing_heart:

* Amanda is an interactive chatbot that keeps track of users tasks and deadlines.
* @param filePath Path to the storage file of main.java.amanda.
while (!isExit) { // amanda runs until isExit return true
c.execute(tasks, ui, store); // executes the command
isExit = c.isExit(); // check if newest user input is an exit command
* AddCommand is a command that adds new tasks to the current task list.
* Adds the task associated with this AddCommand to the current task list
* and calls the ui to show the output to the user.
* @param store the store manager that write any changes to the storage file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, StoreManager store) {
tasks.getList().add(this.task); // add the task to the current task list.
store.store(tasks); // update storage with new task addition .
ui.showAddCommand(tasks, task); // print messages for AddCommand.
* Command that represent a command inputted by user.
* @param task The task associated with this Command.
* @param taskNo The index in the current task list of the task associated with this Command.
* @param store the store manager that write any changes to the storage file.
* @throws AmandaException to handle any wrong input by the user.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, StoreManager store) throws AmandaException {
* Checks if the current command is an Exit Command.
* @return if the current command is an instance of ExitCommand.
* DeleteCommand is a command that delete the specified task number from the current task list.
* Delete the corresponding task to the index input by the user from the current task list and calls the ui
* to shew the output to the user.
* @param store the store manager that write any changes to the storage file.
* @throws AmandaException throw an exception if the index input by the user is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, StoreManager store) throws AmandaException {
if (taskNo > tasks.getList().size() | taskNo <= 0) { // Check if index input by user is in the valid range.
throw new AmandaException("     That task does not even exist. Why are you wasting my time?");
tasks.getList().remove(taskNo - 1); // remove the task from the list.
store.store(tasks); // update the storage with the removal of the task.
ui.showDeleteCommand(tasks); // print messages for Delete Command.
* ExitCommand is a command that print the exit message for the program.
* Call the ui to show goodbye message.
* @param store the store manager that write any changes to the storage file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, StoreManager store) {
* ListCommand is a class that lists the current task in the task list.
* Iterate through the current task list and prints the tasks.
* @param store the store manager that write any changes to the storage file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, StoreManager store) {
ui.showListCommand(); // print the messages for ListCommand.
for (int i = 0; i < tasks.getList().size(); i++) { // iterate through current task list and print each task.
* MarkCommand is a command that marks a task as done
* @param taskNo the index of the task which the user wants to mark as done.
* Mark the task at the index provided in the constructor as done in the current task list.
* @param store the store manager that write any changes to the storage file.
* @throws AmandaException throw an exception if the index input by the user is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, StoreManager store) throws AmandaException {
if (taskNo > tasks.getList().size() | taskNo <= 0) { // Check if index input by user is in the valid range.
throw new AmandaException("     That task does not even exist. Why are you wasting my time?");
tasks.getList().get(taskNo - 1).doTask(); // mark the current task as done.
store.store(tasks); // update the storage with the new state of the task.
* UnmarkCommand is a command that unmark a task that is done.
* @param taskNo the index of the task which the user wants to unmark.
* Mark the task at the index provided in the constructor as done in the current task list.
* @param store the store manager that write any changes to the storage file.
* @throws AmandaException throw an exception if the index input by the user is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, StoreManager store) throws AmandaException {
if (taskNo > tasks.getList().size() | taskNo <= 0) { // Check if index input by user is in the valid range.
throw new AmandaException("     That task does not even exist. Why are you wasting my time?");
tasks.getList().get(taskNo - 1).undoTask(); // mark the current task as not done.
store.store(tasks); // update the storage with the new state of the task.
ui.showUnmarkCommand(tasks, taskNo); // print messages for UnmarkCommand.
* AmandaException is an exception thrown when amanda doesn't understand the user input.

* @return if the date input is in the correct format

* @return the task corresponding to the user input.
* @throws AmandaException throws an exception when the user input is in the wrong format.
public Task make(String input) throws AmandaException {
String type = tokens.nextToken(); // type is the command word/ first word that the user input at every line.
if (!tokens.hasMoreTokens() && type.equals("deadline")) { // if user did not enter a date.
throw new AmandaException("\nHow do you expect to meet a deadline " +
"if you don't even know when it is?\n");
} else if (!tokens.hasMoreTokens() && type.equals("event")) {  // if user did not enter a date.
